intro: Alchemilla geranioides var. uhligii, commonly known as the Uhl’s lady's mantle, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It features dense, silver-gray foliage that is covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to form dense ground cover in woodland gardens.
